data.title: If you're staying downtown
data.text: It's a nice restaurant with a nice atmosphere. The place was full and the food was good. I had oysters, I would skip those, fish tacos, ok and the alaskan salmon, it was good.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Whale's Tail, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Mariahgo,

Thank you for dining at the Whale's Tail. We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback. We're happy to hear you enjoyed the salmon and fish tacos, as well as the lively atmosphere. We hope to serve you again!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Skip it
data.text: The best that I can say is that the salmon sliders were well prepared, if a little bland.  Our waitress was inexperienced, but pleasant.  Three out of four entrees came out together and when after 15-20 minutes the 4th had still not arrived the waitress said she'd put it in again. Another 29 minutes and nothing so we decided to leave.  Even then, it was another 20 minutes to get the check - and, it was relatively early so they were not overly busy. But the absolute worst was the noise level.  There was loud, harsh music blaring.  The manager agreed to turn it down 'one notch' but that was little help.  It was impossible to have a conversation.  In fact, the noise level was painful - contributing to our desire to leave as soon as possible.  Despite the signs in the hotel - this is not a cosy wine bar and bistro.  If you value your hearing and the company you're with then skip this one.

data.title: Most delicious salmon sliders!
data.text: We really liked the decor and ambiance of The Whale's Tail. There was a DJ spinning in the corner when we arrived and sat at the bar. The salmon sliders on Hawaiian rolls are still showing up in my dreams. They were out of this world delicious! Our bartender Meg was great and we would definitely recommend a visit to this spot.

data.title: Service was really, really bad.
data.text:
The "sweater", I hesitate to call him anything else, had an insolent attitude when he carded us ---63, 62 y.o.--but he had to be under strict orders to do that.

After the carding, he was useless as a person to address problems to and we had problems.
Our server was a young woman who only took us seriously when I threatened to cancel our order with drinks and exit after waiting 40 minutes for food to arrive!
As it developed, the entire order was reported to have been dispatched to the "wrong table". What are the odds the other table's occupants would have ordered the exact same food, at the exact same time?

data.title: Pleasant surprise
data.text: On our final night in Anchorage, we wanted to find somewhere with a bit of atmosphere where we could enjoy a couple of drinks and some food in a relaxed environment - this place fit the bill perfectly. We opted to buy a wine card so that we could sample lots of different wines while having some light bites for dinner (wine samples start from about $3 and you can buy a card for $10 upwards which worked really well for us). The wines were all excellent, the food yummy and the staff friendly. The other bars in the Captain Cook Hotel were a bit too 'cruisey' for us (the hotel must be popular with people on a cruise package) but The Whales Tail was great.
